thread.title: Red Sox Outfielders Grace ‘Sports Illustrated’ Cover
thread.title_full: Red Sox Outfielders Grace ‘Sports Illustrated’ Cover

author: CBS Boston
title: Red Sox Outfielders Grace ‘Sports Illustrated’ Cover

organizations.name: red sox outfielders grace ‘sports illustrated’ cover red sox outfielders grace ‘sports illustrated

text:
Red Sox Outfielders Grace ‘Sports Illustrated’ Cover March 21, 2017 12:40 PM Filed Under: Andrew Benintendi , Baseball , Boston Red Sox , Jackie Bradley Jr. , MLB , Mookie Betts , Sports Illustrated , Sports News Andrew Benintendi, Jackie Bradley Jr., and Mookie Betts celebrate following a Red Sox win over the Baltimore Orioles. (Photo by Rob Carr/Getty Images) 
BOSTON (CBS) — The Red Sox enter the 2017 season with perhaps the best young outfield in baseball. Sports Illustrated decided to put the spotlight on the talented trio for its next cover. 
As part of the magazine’s annual baseball preview issue, Red Sox outfielders Mookie Betts, Andrew Benintendi, and Jackie Bradley Jr. are featured one one of three covers. The Killer B's of the @RedSox outfield are featured on one of three covers as part of our MLB preview issue! pic.twitter.com/ysAOGe3O57 
— Sports Illustrated (@SInow) March 21, 2017 
The other two covers feature the defending league MVPs, Los Angeles Angels center fielder Mike Trout and Chicago Cubs third baseman Kris Bryant. This @MikeTrout guy is pretty good, so we put the @Angels outfielder on one of three covers as part of our MLB preview issue! pic.twitter.com/WPOw3nN3OV 
— Sports Illustrated (@SInow) March 21, 2017 Big smile, bigger bat. @KrisBryant_23 represents the defending champion @Cubs on one of three covers as part of our MLB preview issue! pic.twitter.com/MTVabqBtlh 
— Sports Illustrated (@SInow) March 21, 2017 
Betts, Benintendi, and Bradley are also featured in a story by Tom Verducci about the Red Sox’ post-David Ortiz clubhouse culture, which was published on SI.com last Wednesday. 
Hopefully you don’t believe in curses. The Sports Illustrated cover curse is one of the most popular in sports.
